note.para: The splitter gear set MUST remain in time during the installation of the rear bearings.

step1.para: Center the rear of either countershaft assembly in the bearing bore and use a soft bar to start rear bearing in the bore ( Figure 325). Complete installation with a flanged-end bearing driver and maul. Repeat the procedure with other auxiliary countershaft assembly, making sure the splitter gear set has remained in time.

figure.caption: Figure 324. Start Rear Bearing in Bore

note.para: Check the synchronizer assembly for springs that may have been released from the bores in the high range ring during bearing installation.

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of each countershaft ( Figure 326).

figure.caption: Figure 325. Install Snap Ring in Groove at Rear of Countershaft

step1.para: Position the new gasket on the cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers ( Figure 327). Apply Loctite 242 to the bolt threads and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 326. Install Both Rear Bearing Covers
